errors.error_description: The `[p]repo add` command specifies the `master` branch, which is incompatible with Red-DiscordBot V3. The correct branch is `V3`.
correction_candidates: Change 'master' to 'V3' in the command.
[p]repo add Fixator10-Cogs https://github.com/fixator10/Fixator10-Cogs V3
[p]repo add Fixator10-Cogs https://github.com/fixator10/Fixator10-Cogs --branch V3
[p]repo add Fixator10-Cogs https://github.com/fixator10/Fixator10-Cogs

errors.error_description: The `[p]cog install` command uses a comma as a separator between the repo name and the cog name, which is syntactically incorrect.
correction_candidates: [p]cog install Fixator10-Cogs <cog_name>
[p]cog install Fixator10-Cogs --cog <cog_name>
[p]cog install from Fixator10-Cogs <cog_name>
[p]cog install <cog_name> from Fixator10-Cogs

errors.error_description: An incorrect dependency installation step (`pip install red-cogs`) is included. Red cogs are not installed via pip.
correction_candidates: Remove the line 'pip install red-cogs'.
Replace 'pip install red-cogs' with '[p]pip install red-cogs'.
Red cogs are installed via the downloader, not pip. This step should be removed.
The correct command is 'pip install red-discordbot'.

errors.error_description: The installation steps are in the wrong order. The `[p]cog install` command is placed before the `[p]repo add` command, which will cause the installation to fail because the repo is not yet known to the bot.
correction_candidates: Swap the order of the two installation commands.
First run '[p]repo add', then run '[p]cog install'.
The '[p]repo add' command must be executed before '[p]cog install'.
Combine the commands into one: '[p]cog install from https://github.com/fixator10/Fixator10-Cogs <cog_name>'
errors.golden_answer: The '[p]repo add' command must be executed before '[p]cog install'.

errors.error_description: Added unnecessary dependency installation step that conflicts with Red-DiscordBot's existing environment
correction_candidates: Remove the pip install command as Red-DiscordBot already manages its dependencies
Replace with `[p]pipinstall discord.py aiohttp requests` command instead
Move the dependency installation to after the repo add command
Change to `conda install discord.py aiohttp requests` for better package management
errors.golden_answer: Remove the pip install command as Red-DiscordBot already manages its dependencies
